titleStmt.title: The Vercelli Book: a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Unknown

availability.p: Not to ricirculate. Contact the Digital Vercelli Project researchers for more information.

msIdentifier.repository: Biblioteca e Archivio Capitolare di Vercelli

msContents.summary: The Codex Vercellensis, or Vercelli Book, as it is known in the Anglo-Saxon world and now also in Italy, is a manuscript dating back to the end of the 10th century, containing miscellaneous religious works, in verse and prose: 23 homilies in prose and 6 poetic works following the Anglo-Saxon alliterative metrics.
msContents.textLang: The primary language in this manuscript is Old English, with a few isolated Latin words and phrases.

msItem.title: Homily I
msItem.incipit: ſceaþe for þan ne meaht ðu þa þrowunge gelettan
msItem.explicit: ain ecneꞅꞅe þurh eallra woruld aworuld AmeN abutan ende

msItem.title: Homily II
msItem.incipit: MENÐALE OFESTAN. þæꞅ myclan dóm dægeꞅ worc bið ſwiðe egeꞅ lic ⁊andryꞅ
msItem.explicit: þurh ealra woruld aworuld aabutan ende am̄

msItem.title: Homily III
msItem.incipit: BRoðor þa leofestan ic cyðe þæt þreo þing ſynt ærest
msItem.explicit: á in ecneꞅꞅe þurh ealra woruld aworuld aabutan ende AMEN.

msItem.title: Homily IV
msItem.incipit: Men þa leofestan, ıc eow bidde ⁊eaðmodlice lære
msItem.explicit: þær he leofað ⁊ricꞅað ın ealra worulda woruld abutan ende amen;

msItem.title: Homily V
msItem.incipit: to middan wintra Oſtende nob̄ dne
msItem.explicit: we ureꞅ dryhtneꞅ naman hælendeꞅ criſteꞅ he leofað ⁊ricꞅað áábutan ende ;

msItem.title: Andreas
msItem.incipit: Hwæt! We gefrunan on fyrndagum
msItem.explicit: ece mid englum. þæt is æðele cyning!

msItem.title: Fates of the Apostles
msItem.incipit: Hwæt! Ic þysne sang siðgeomor fand
msItem.explicit: ece ond edgiong, ofer ealle gesceaft.

msItem.title: Homily VI
msItem.incipit: INcipit narrare miracula quefacta fuerant ante aduentum saluatoris
msItem.explicit: gyldeð uꞅ god ece mede æt uꞅꞅum ende;

msItem.title: Homily VII
msItem.incipit: BUTAN tweon lar iꞅ halig domeꞅ dæl ⁊ealleꞅ ſwiðoſt
msItem.explicit: ꞅynt onþã toweardan rice mid þam hælendan criſte. ⁊midþã halegan gaſte ınealra worulda woruld;

msItem.title: Homily VIII
msItem.incipit: MENĐA leofeꞅtan manað uꞅ ⁊myngað onþyꞅꞅum bocum
msItem.explicit: ⁊ mid ðam godeꞅ ꞅuna ðam þe aliofað ⁊rixaþ mid fæder ⁊mid ꞅuna ato widan feore ameN

msItem.title: Homily IX
msItem.incipit: MEN ðaleofestan manað uꞅ ⁊mingaþ þeoꞅ halige boc þæt
msItem.explicit: we mid him ⁊mid hiꞅ þam halegan gæꞅte wunigean ınealra worulda woruld ameN ;

msItem.title: Homily X
msItem.incipit: HERsagað on þyꞅꞅum halegũ bocum be ælmihtigeꞅ
msItem.explicit: drihten criſt wunaþ ⁊rixað mid eallũ halegum abutan ende ameN

msItem.title: Homily XI
msItem.incipit: ſpelto forman gang dæge. MEN ðaleofestan þiꞅ ꞅindon halige dagaꞅ ⁊halwendlice
msItem.explicit: gefultumige þe ofer uꞅ ealle liofað ⁊rixað. ameN

msItem.title: Homily XII
msItem.incipit: ſpeltoðam oðrum gang dæge GIR ꞅan dæg we wæron manode menþa leofestan þiꞅꞅa haliga
msItem.explicit: midhim ⁊mid hiꞅ halgum ainealra worulda woruld on ecnesse 

msItem.title: Homily XIII
msItem.incipit: ſpelto þriddan gangdæge ÐISISꞅe þridda dæg men þa leofeſtan þyꞅꞅe halgan tide þe uꞅ
msItem.explicit: world to widan feore midfæder ⁊mid ꞅuna ⁊midþam halgan gaſte in ecneꞅꞅe ameN 

msItem.title: Homily XIV
msItem.incipit: lar ſpel to ſwylcere tide ſwa man wile . MEN ða leofestan þiꞅꞅynt halige dagaꞅ ⁊gaſtlice ⁊uꞅꞅũ
msItem.explicit: odeꞅ halgum onþone heofen lican eðel ⁊þæꞅ ꞅiððan brucan onecneꞅꞅe amen ;

msItem.title: Homily XV
msItem.incipit: ALIA OMELIADEDI E IVDICII. M sægð us onþyꞅꞅum bocum huꞅe halga thomas godes apsł
msItem.explicit: ece gefean abutan ende ı scl̄a scl̄orum in secula seculorum ameN

msItem.title: Homily XVI
msItem.incipit: OMELIA EPYFFANIA DNI M̄ sceolon we nú hwylcum hwegm wordum secgan be
msItem.explicit: rixað nú áþurh eallra woruld áworuld ábutan ende ın ꞅclā sclōrum ameN.

msItem.title: Homily XVII
msItem.incipit: DEPURIFICATIO SCAMIA M[Men þa leofestan] sægeð uꞅ ⁊myngaþ þiꞅ halige god ſpel be þysse arwyrðan
msItem.explicit: aworuld abutan ende ınsca scorum am̄;in sæcula sæculorum, amen.

msItem.title: Homily XVIII
msItem.incipit: DE SCO MARTINO CONF. M̄ magon we nu hwylcum hwego wordum asecgan
msItem.explicit: leofaþ ⁊rixaþ á ıneallra woruld aworld abutan ende ameN;

msItem.title: Soul and Body I
msItem.incipit: Huru, ðæs behofað hæleða æghwylc
msItem.explicit: geþungen þrymlice þysses

msItem.title: Homiletic Fragment I
msItem.incipit: sorh cymeð / manig ond mislic in manna dream.
msItem.explicit: eorðan lifes ende gewyrcan!

msItem.title: The Dream of the Rood
msItem.incipit: Hwæt! Ic swefna cyst secgan wylle
msItem.explicit: ælmihtig god, þær his eðel wæs

msItem.title: Homily XIX
msItem.incipit: MENða leofestan uꞅ gedafenaþ æreꞅt
msItem.explicit: ꞅuna . ⁊mid þam haligan gaſte . ábutan ende amen :,

msItem.title: Homily XX
msItem.incipit: MMEMENNÐA leofestan þiſ ꞅyndon halige dagaꞅ ⁊hal
msItem.explicit: efen ecan haligan gafre abutan ende :,

msItem.title: Homily XXI
msItem.incipit: MENĐALEOfestan usys mycel þearf þæt we god lufien of eallre
msItem.explicit: haligan gaſte onwuldre ⁊onwyrð mynde áábutan ende onecneꞅꞅe;

msItem.title: Homily XXII
msItem.incipit: hER ſægð hu sc̄s isodorus spræc be ðære sawle gedale ⁊be
msItem.explicit: her on worulde ⁊on þære toweardan. seðe leofað ⁊ricsað aabutan ende in ecnesse

msItem.title: Elene
msItem.incipit: þa wæs agangen geara hwyrftum
msItem.explicit: wuldorcyninges to widan feore. Amen.

msItem.title: Homily XXIII
msItem.incipit: Wæꞅ þær inþam ſprecenan iglande sum mycel hlæw of eorþan ge
msItem.explicit: fona riceꞅ wuldre abutan ende onecneꞅꞅe amen fiat:,

collation.p:
The Vercelli Book consists of 19 quires, marked with Roman numerals at the beginning of each quire, and with letters at the end. Originally the quires were based on eight leaves of parchment, but many leafs are missing and a few single leaves have been added sporadically. 1(10,-7), 2(12,-4,-8,-11), 3(8,-6,-8), 4(10,-3,-7), 5(10,-4,-8), 6(8,-3), 7(10,-4,-8), 8(12,-4,-8), 9(10,-4,-8), 10(10,-5,-9), 11(10,-4,-6,-8,-10), 12(6), 13(10,-3,-7,-9), 14(8,-3,-7), 15(8,-6), 16(10,-1,-4,-8), 17(4,-3,-4), 18(8), 19(8,-8)
None Quires begin on fols. 1(1), [...]

layout.p: Text is written in a single column per parchment leaf.

handDesc.p: In the opinion of many scholars, the manuscript was written by a single scribe, who has been particularly diligent and meticulous in using the writing of that period, the Anglo-Saxon square minuscule.

decoDesc.p: The Vercelli Book is very simple in appearance, in fact only three initials are decorated (H on f. 49r, M on ff. 106v and 112r) with new texts usually beginning with a larger, undecorated initial.

history.origin: The manuscript was written in England, presumably in the South-Eastern area, and seems to have never have left the country until the end of the eleventh century, since some notes in Old English were written into the margins and can be dated back to that time.
history.provenance: It is still unclear how and when it came to Italy, a Latin verse of Psalm XXVI in neumatic notation written in Italian handwriting can be dated to the early XII century and is then a reasonable post-quem term.

hyphenation.p: Physical line breaks are rigidly observed.
